(I stole some words from a very proud daughter who honored Garry on her personal page.)
It was over 16 years ago that Garry made the decision to run for a seat on the Beaverton School Board and during the time he served, has seen many changes along the way. He has voted with much thought and deliberation on many crucial issues to assure a positive outcome for our school district and we thank him for that. Garry's years on the Board also allowed him the honor to personally hand 5 of his 6 Grandchildren their diplomas as they walked across the graduation stage. As he has now resigned from his position, we want to acknowledge his service to the students, staff, administration at Beaverton Schools. Thanks Garry ❤

Thank you Garry Clark for your years of service and commitment to Beaverton.

Governor Whitmer ordered all Michigan residents to remain at home to avoid further spread of COVID-19 and that order has now been extended through at least the end of April. We had hoped that the stay at home order would be lifted soon and that we would be able to take part in the many end-of-year traditions that we have loved. However, it is clear to us now that this is not the case.

I am so sorry to inform you that Prom, scheduled for Saturday, May 2, has been canceled. Also canceled is the 8th grade trip to Mackinac Island. We know that these are two of the many events you were looking forward to this spring. We are sure that this is upsetting to students, parents, and friends, but it is necessary.

Decisions on other planned events will be made in the coming weeks including awards presentations and graduation.

During this crisis, we must put the health and safety of all students first.
